Mild bodily function reference
Context-dependent severity, can be targeting or general

Intensive form, often used for emphasis

Religious term often misunderstood, context-dependent severity

category_system.description: Hierarchical categorization system based on content type and social impact
category_system.methodology: Based on academic research and community standards for content moderation

general.name: General Profanity
general.description: Common swear words and mild expletives without specific targeting
general.examples_note: Basic profanity used for emphasis or frustration

sexual.name: Sexual Content
sexual.description: Words related to sexual acts, anatomy, or sexually explicit content

violence.name: Violence and Aggression
violence.description: Words promoting or describing violence, threats, or aggressive behavior

subcategories.threats: Direct or implied threats of harm
subcategories.weapons: References to weapons in threatening context

hate_speech.name: Hate Speech
hate_speech.description: Language targeting individuals or groups based on identity characteristics

substance_abuse.name: Substance Abuse
substance_abuse.description: References to illegal drugs, drug culture, and substance abuse

body_parts.name: Inappropriate Anatomical References
body_parts.description: Crude or inappropriate references to body parts
body_parts.examples_note: Anatomical terms used inappropriately or crudely

subcategories.scatological: References to bodily waste and functions

slurs.name: Slurs and Derogatory Terms
slurs.description: Derogatory terms targeting specific groups or individuals
slurs.examples_note: Offensive terms for groups and individuals

religious.name: Religious Profanity
religious.description: Blasphemous or sacrilegious language targeting religious beliefs

1.description: Generally acceptable in casual conversation but may be filtered in formal settings

2.description: Inappropriate in most professional or public settings

3.description: Highly offensive and inappropriate in most contexts

4.description: Extremely offensive, potentially illegal, or causing significant harm

cross_category_considerations.contextual_severity: Words may have different severity levels depending on context and target
cross_category_considerations.cultural_variations: Severity may vary across different English-speaking regions
cross_category_considerations.temporal_evolution: Categories and severity levels evolve with changing social norms

context_system.description: Context-sensitive word analysis and exception handling for English profanity detection
context_system.methodology: Multi-layered contextual analysis including semantic, syntactic, and pragmatic considerations

whitelist.description: Words that should never be flagged as profanity regardless of context

legitimate_words.description: Standard dictionary words that may contain profanity substrings

proper_nouns.description: Names, places, and proper nouns that may contain flagged substrings
detection_rules: Words preceded by title indicators (Mr., Mrs., Dr.)

abbreviations.description: Common abbreviations that may trigger false positives

educational_contexts.description: Academic or educational discussions about language

considerations: Maintain historical accuracy while noting offensive nature
Provide content warnings for historical slurs
Consider educational value vs. potential harm

artistic_expression.description: Creative works including literature, music, and performance

medical_scientific.description: Medical or scientific discussions using technical terminology

legal_proceedings.description: Legal documents, court records, or legal discussions

aggressive_intent.description: Language intended to harm, threaten, or intimidate

casual_usage.description: Profanity used for emphasis without targeting

group_targeting.description: Profanity directed at groups or demographics

inanimate_targeting.description: Profanity directed at objects or concepts

noun_usage.description: Profanity used as nouns, potentially targeting

sentence_initial.description: Profanity at the beginning of sentences

sentence_final.description: Profanity at the end of sentences

repeated_usage.description: Recent repeated use of profanity by same user

escalation_patterns.description: Increasing severity of profanity over time

british_english.cultural_notes: Some terms considered milder in British context

australian_english.casual_usage: More casual use of certain terms

younger_users.description: Different profanity norms among younger users

implementation_guidelines.fallback_behavior: When context is unclear, err on the side of caution with standard severity ratings

primary_sources.name: LDNOOBW (List of Dirty, Naughty, Obscene and Otherwise Bad Words)
dsojevic/profanity-list
primary_sources.description: Highly consumable profanity list with severity ratings and tags

primary_sources.name: censor-text/profanity-list
primary_sources.description: Multilingual profanity collection for automated censorship

academic_sources.name: Automated Hate Speech Detection and the Problem of Offensive Language
academic_sources.description: Academic research on offensive language categorization

academic_sources.name: Detection of Offensive Language and Its Severity for Low Resource Language
academic_sources.description: Recent research on severity-based classification systems

usage_notes.cultural_context: Primarily North American and British English
limitations: Regional variations may not be fully covered
ethical_considerations: Balance between safety and freedom of expression

severity_system.description: Four-level severity classification system for English profanity
severity_system.methodology: Based on academic research, social impact assessment, and community standards

1.name: Mild
1.description: Low-impact profanity generally acceptable in casual conversation

usage_guidelines.content_rating: May appear in PG-13 or teen-rated content
usage_guidelines.workplace_appropriateness: Generally inappropriate in formal business settings
usage_guidelines.educational_context: May be acceptable in certain educational discussions

characteristics: Often used for emphasis rather than targeting
1.legal_status: Generally not subject to broadcast restrictions in most jurisdictions
1.social_impact: Minimal to low impact on recipients

2.name: Moderate
2.description: Moderate profanity inappropriate in professional and many social contexts

usage_guidelines.filtering_recommendation: Recommended filtering in professional and family contexts
usage_guidelines.content_rating: Typically requires R rating or mature content warning
usage_guidelines.educational_context: May be discussed in academic contexts with appropriate warnings

characteristics: May cause offense in formal settings
2.legal_status: Subject to broadcast restrictions during certain hours
2.social_impact: Moderate impact, may cause discomfort or offense

3.name: Strong
3.description: Strong profanity highly offensive and inappropriate in most contexts

usage_guidelines.filtering_recommendation: Strong recommendation for filtering in most contexts
usage_guidelines.content_rating: Requires explicit content warnings or mature ratings
usage_guidelines.workplace_appropriateness: Unacceptable and may violate harassment policies
usage_guidelines.educational_context: Only appropriate in specialized academic research contexts

3.legal_status: Generally prohibited in broadcast media and may violate platform terms
3.social_impact: High impact, likely to cause offense and may create hostile environments

4.name: Severe
4.description: Extreme profanity with severe social impact, potentially illegal or harmful

usage_guidelines.filtering_recommendation: Mandatory filtering in virtually all contexts
usage_guidelines.content_rating: Prohibited in most commercial content platforms
usage_guidelines.workplace_appropriateness: Grounds for disciplinary action or termination
usage_guidelines.educational_context: Only appropriate in highly specialized academic research with strict ethical oversight

characteristics: Targets individuals or groups based on identity
May constitute hate speech or harassment
4.legal_status: May constitute hate speech, harassment, or threats under various jurisdictions
4.social_impact: Severe impact, may cause trauma, perpetuate discrimination, or incite violence

intent_factors.targeting: Words directed at individuals or groups increase severity
intent_factors.harassment: Repeated or systematic use increases severity
intent_factors.threat_implication: Words implying threats or violence increase severity

context_factors.public_forum: Public contexts may increase severity impact
context_factors.power_dynamics: Authority figures using profanity may increase severity

mitigating_factors.self_reference: Self-directed profanity may have reduced severity
mitigating_factors.artistic_expression: Creative contexts may justify lower severity ratings
mitigating_factors.educational_discourse: Academic discussion may warrant contextual consideration

escalation_rules: Multiple severity 2+ words in single message upgrade overall severity
Combination with targeting language increases severity by 1 level
Repeated violations within timeframe increase effective severity
de_escalation_considerations: Historical or academic context may reduce effective severity
Clear non-malicious intent may warrant severity reduction
Community standards and cultural context should be considered

special_cases.medical_terminology: Medical or scientific terms generally not subject to severity ratings
special_cases.reclaimed_language: Some communities may reclaim certain terms, requiring contextual analysis
special_cases.cross_linguistic: Borrowed words from other languages may require special consideration

update_protocol.community_feedback: User reports and community input should inform severity adjustments
update_protocol.academic_updates: New research on language harm should trigger severity reviews
update_protocol.cultural_shifts: Evolving social norms may require severity recalibration

variation_system.description: Comprehensive patterns for detecting obfuscated, modified, and variant forms of profanity
variation_system.methodology: Pattern-based approach covering leetspeak, spacing, repetition, and symbol substitutions
variation_system.detection_approach: Fuzzy matching with configurable similarity thresholds

word_splitting.description: Characters separated by spaces or other delimiters

sound_alike.description: Words that sound similar to profanity

jaro_winkler.description: String similarity metric optimized for typos

regex_patterns.description: Regular expression patterns for systematic variations

optimization_notes: Use trie structures for prefix matching
Implement caching for repeated phrase analysis
Consider early termination for obvious non-matches
scaling_recommendations: Limit fuzzy matching scope based on string length
Use progressive filtering (simple to complex patterns)
Implement confidence scoring to reduce false positives
